description: As of March 16, the government of Latvia announced that preschools and childcare facilities will only be available for children whose parents may prove that the child and family have not been abroad and have not been in contact with Covid-19 patients or their contacts during the last 14 days. Parents must also state in this certificate that it is not possible to provide childcare in any other way.

institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions

description: On April 30th Latvia decided to cancel 9th grader exams for this school year and reduce number of exams for 12th school grade. UPDATE: On April 30th Lativa decided to keep schools closed. All state tests for 9th graders in Latvia have been cancelled for this school year. The number of compulsory tests for 12th graders has been reduced. Now compulsory exams include only one foreign language exam, Latvian language exam and mathematics exam.

description: Latvia limits time for culture, entertainment, outdoor sports and other recreational activities from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

Latvia limits time for culture, entertainment, outdoor sports and other recreational activities from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. UPDATE: The original restriction of working hours of leisure and entertainment venues, including restaurants, was from 8.00 to 22.00. Now they will be able to open from 07:00 until midnight.

On 29 December 2020, the government of Latvia introduced a curfew for New Year's holidays and weekend from December 30 until January 4, and the weekend following Orthodox Christmas on January 8 and 9, during which individuals must stay at their place of residence between 22:00 and 5:00 except for emergencies and work-related matters
Latvian government decided that current safety measures such as the curfew from 22.00 to 5.00 a.m. at nights from Friday to Saturday and from Saturday to Sunday will be extended until January 25
Latvia declares  state of emergency due to COVID-19 from March 14 until April 14 with possibility to be prolonged
On 26 May, the Prime Minister announced that Latvia is planning to end the country's corona-related state of emergency by June 9.

Latvia declares  state of emergency due to COVID-19 from March 14 until April 14 with possibility to be prolonged. This policy has been prolonged to 9 June. UPDATE: Originally supposed to end 14 April, Latvia's state of emergency has been extended to 9 June.

Latvia has extended its start of emergency (originally from 14 March to 14 April) to 12 May. UPDATE: Latvia originally declared a state of emergency from 14 March - 14 April, but now it has been extended to 12 May
As announced on 4 June the state of emergency in Latvia will end on 9 June
Avoid travel to China's Hubei province, says Latvian Foreign Ministry on Jan 31

description: Latvia will stop nearly all foreigners entering the country from March 17 2020 on. All international travel, by air, railway, sea and road, will be cancelled. Latvians and foreigners with residency rights in Latvia will be able to enter the country, and tourists will be able to leave after the deadline.

Latvians and foreigners with residency rights in Latvia will be able to enter the country, and tourists will be able to leave after the deadline. Starting 15 May, Latvia will allow citizens to/from between Estonia and Lithuania. UPDATE: Originally, Latvia restricted all travel in and out of the country starting 17 March. On 15 May, Latvia has opened a 'travel bubble' with Estonia and Lithuania to allow citizens of these countries to travel freely between these three countries.

description: Latvia has extended its international air travel ban to 12 May. UPDATE: Latvia originally announced a ban on international air travel (among other forms of international travel) from 17 March to 14 April, but now this has been extended to 12 May.

description: From July 16, the government of Latvia will not accept applications for the long term category D visa for residents of countries with a total of 14 days of 16 or more new Covid-19 infections per 100,000 inhabitants.

description: On September 11, the government of Latvia restricted travelers from Estonia. The government will require travelers coming from Estonia to self-quarantine for two weeks, granting an exception to truck drivers, diplomats and others who need to cross the border for work to skip the self-quarantine with proof of employment.

description: On February 25, the Ministry of Health of Latvia announced persons returning from China, South Korea, Iran, Lombardy and Veneto in Italy who exhibit symptoms such as cough, fever, sore throat or difficulty breathing should call 113 to report their symptoms.

Latvia government stated on 29th March: For the purposes of conducting an epidemiological investigation and verifying the veracity of information on movement provided by a person and upon the request of the Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, the State Police will have the right to request information from electronic communications operators on specific persons who may have a status of the infected person or contact person.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From July 16, the government of Latvia announced all passengers of international transport will have to submit a completed questionnaire to the carrier before entering Latvia, indicating the countries visited during the last 14 days, contact information and chosen address where the two-week self-isolation period is planned. Information on passengers who have been in Covid-19-affected countries will be passed on to the National Police for self-isolation control and the Center for Disease Prevention and Control to identify possible contact persons promptly if necessary.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: During Latvia's state of emergency (14 March-14 April), non-essential hospital services like in-patient surgical operations, paid visits to specialists, use of a podologist, and consultation of a physician in the Rare Diseases Room are restricted.

description: Latvia made prioritization of medical item supply for national purposes

On April 23, the government of Latvia approved the use of accelerated Covid-19 testing processes. These tests are approved to be used in cases such as a patient in need of emergency surgery is admitted to hospital or in certain circumstances such as a heart attack or stroke.

description: On April 30, the Ministry of Education and Science of Latvia allocated half a million euro to Covid-19 epidemiological research.

description: On July 14, the government of Latvia decided to allocate 3.2 million euros to the health sector to cover the expenses of medical institutions for the diagnosis and treatment of Covid-19.

On August 11, the government of Latvia and the Latvia Ministry of Health allocated €5 millions to the health sector to cover reimbursement of patient co-payments, to provide drug supplies to medical institutions and for the organization and performance of laboratory tests (test kits, testing sites, PPE for staff).

On August 11, the government of Latvia and the Latvia Ministry of Health allocated €5 millions to the health sector to cover reimbursement of patient co-payments, to provide drug supplies to medical institutions and for the organization and performance of laboratory tests (test kits, testing sites, PPE for staff).

On April 14, the Ministry of Health of Latvia allowed employers of retail to test his or her employees with symptoms on COVID-19, if they wish to do so. In this case, a designated representative of the industry must contact the emergency medical service to schedule a test.
From June 10 to June 30 everyone in Latvia has the opportunity to take a state-paid Covid-19 test, even if there are no symptoms, according to Latvia's Ministry of Health.

As of July 28, the Ministry of Health of Latvia require guest workers from countries with high COVID-19 risk to be tested for the infection before starting work, specifically five to seven days after arrival in Latvia. Until a negative result comes back, the person must comply with self-isolation.

Latvian Finance Minister Jānis Reirs’ initiated a work group for support of entrepreneurship and the employed on Wednesday. At 1 April they decided to finance efforts to battle consequences from COVID-19 from the state budget. The work group ordered Economy Ministry to develop an economic recovery plan.
Later EU funds might be needed, Finance Ministry work group will review proposals on distribution of funding from EU funds.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 13, Latvia (Prime Minister + Finance Minister + Central Bank Governor) announces financial instruments (a billion-euro fund) to assist businesses via the state-owned ALTUM development bank. Possible measures are e.g.: tax holidays, paying for sick leave, import and export guarantees
type_text: Economic / financial policy to cope with potential economic crisis in relation with the pandemic crisis

description: Latvia recommends to cancel all unneccessary travel abroad
On March 24, the government of Latvia opened a phone number that will be available 24 hours a day for those living in Latvia to call and receive information regarding Covid-19.
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public

description: Starting July 11, restaurants and places that serve food must clearly post information pertaining to the maximum number of persons who may be present at the restaurants and places that serve food, according to the government of Latvia. It is noted that this information must be posted at the very least near the entrance and the cashier.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On February 25, the government of Latvia announced children returning from countries affected by covid-19 must self-quarantine for 14 days at home, including staying home from school.
Latvia releases guidelines for quarantine: all persons returning from abroad and persons who have come into contact with a Covid-19 infected person should go into self-isolation at home for 14 days

From 3 June onward it will no longer be necessary to undergo a 14-day self-isolation measure when entering Latvia from the majority of European Union member states, as decided by Latvian government on Tuesday, 2 June. The main requirement is for origin countries to not register more than 15 new COVID-19 infection cases per 100 000 residents.
As of 8th June, a foreigner who enters Latvia and has a 14-day cumulative number of Covid-19 cases per 100,000 population must have self-isolation for 10 days.

From 3 June onward it will no longer be necessary to undergo a 14-day self-isolation measure when entering Latvia from the majority of European Union member states, as decided by Latvian government on Tuesday, 2 June. The main requirement is for origin countries to not register more than 15 new COVID-19 infection cases per 100 000 residents. UPDATE: From June 10th tourist trips (both private and operator-organized) can now be freely organized to countries with low COVID-19 prevalence, while respecting all safety requirements.

From 15 July the holders of Latvian residence permits who broke quarantine rules could expect to have their permits revoked and visa holders would face having their visas cancelled by the Office of Citizenship and Migration Affairs (PMLP).
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: All European countries (except the Vatican) from 26th of September require self-isolation upon arrival in Latvia.

Latvia closes all non essential businesses from March 13. This includes: 
Nightclubs, entertainment centres, fitness clubs. Some restaurants and bars are open (e.g. take away). Shopping malls are closed. Exceptions are: food shops, press kiosks, pharmacies (incl. veterinary pharmacies), vaccination cabinets, opticians, pet food, dry cleaners, hygiene and household stores, building and garden supply stores.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
As of June 9, the government of Latvia issued rules and restrictions for the food service industry to continue operations, including requiring table disinfection after each visitor's meal, having no more than 4 visitors who are not members of the same household indoors at one table, 
having no more than 8 visitors who are not members of the same household at one table outdoors,  distance of two meters between the tables is observed, if there is no partition wall between them, and hours between 6:30-2:00.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Latvian government and public agencies (without further specification) will use remote methods of communication rather than face-to-face interviews wherever possible from March 12th

description: On 16 June, Latvian Parliament supported amendments to the Law on Elections of the Republic City Council and Municipality Council, which allow voters to participate in municipal elections by mail
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with no conditions attached

description: Latvia bans organised public events. All other gatherings may not exceed 50 participants from March 14. All events have to end by 11pm
Lavtiva bans large public gatherins with over 200 people from 13 March

Latvia bans large public gatherings with over 200 people from 13 March. Updates to this policy added further restrictions to the number of people, but as of 12 May the country is allowing public gatherings of up to 25 people. UPDATE: The original severe restrictions on public gatherings, starting 13 March, are being relaxed to allow for public gatherings of up to 25 people starting 12 May.
As of May 12, the government of Latvia allowed non-contact sports to begin lessons and training with the stipulation that no more than 25 people gather in one training group at the same time.
type_sub_cat: Annually recurring event allowed to occur with certain conditions

description: As of May 12, the government of Latvia allowed non-contact sports training and lessons to occur in-person with the stipulation that indoor training may not exceed three hours. There is no limit for outdoor sessions.
type_sub_cat: Annually recurring event allowed to occur with certain conditions

description: Starting June 9, the government of Latvia requires public markets and food places to provide at least 4m^2 of space indoors per visitor.

Starting June 9, the government of Latvia requires public markets and food places to provide at least 4m^2 of space indoors per visitor. From July 1, restaurants must provide 3 m^2 of space per visitor. UPDATE: The original policy requires public markets and food places to provide at least 4m^2 of space indoors per visitor. The new policy requires public markets and food places to provide 3 m^2 of space per visitor.
From July 1 until July 31, the government of Latvia will allow events with up to 500 people in larger indoor spaces.
From July 1 to July 31, the government of Latvia will allow no more than 1000 people to gather outside.
Starting August 1, the government of Latvia will allow as many as 3,000 people to gather outside, provided that the epidemiological situation in the country does not deteriorate.
Starting from August 17, the government of Latvia will allow up to 1,000 people to gather indoors.
Latvia restricts private outside activities: two people only, exception for families, keeping a distance of 2 meters from anyone else

On 29 March, Latvia adopted stricter regulations: all persons must maintain a 2-meter distance (exception: 2 persons, persons living in one household, parents to minor children) and observe epidemiological safety measures in private and public events, as well as during public indoor and outdoor activities. All private arrangements (except funerals), public events, meetings, processions, pickets, indoor sports and religious activities are prohibited.

From 14 March, Latvia's prime minister announced that only groups of two people or families can gather at once in public places during state of emergency period, and that a 2-meter minimum distance must be maintained from other people.

On March 31 the Latvian government put a ban on people who have come to Latvia from abroad from using public transportation, having guests and going to meetings. 

The penalty for non-compliance with compulsory emergency epidemiological requirements will be up to EUR 2,000 for natural persons and up to EUR 5,000 for legal entities.
On May 12, Minister of Transport of Latvia began the requirement of mask use when using public transport.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On May 12, Minister of Transport of Latvia began the requirement of mask use when using public transport. On July 1, it will no longer be necessary to use a mask on public transport. It will be recommended for use - especially for people with signs of respiratory disease (runny nose, cough) and people who have come from abroad with a high incidence of Covid-19 when going to a place of self-isolation using public transport. UPDATE: The original policy required mask use for all who use public transport, announced May 12. The policy has changed and  it will no longer be necessary to use a mouth and nose mask on public transport, starting July 1.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)
